titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1126_01
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1126_01

encodingDesc.p: The original encoding was done in plain text files following the encoding quidelines of the Morgenländische Gesellschaft. With a dedicated web application these plain text files were transformed into XML documents validating (partially) against the Epidoc-Schema and those XML-Documents have been further sematically annotaded.
In order to avoid well known xml-issues especially in regards of overlapping elements the actual edited/annotated text was multiplied in several anonymos blocks, each block providing specific markup.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.Salmān 2.Dhū-Saḥar has dedicated to ʾĪlmuquh, 3.[of ʾA]wwām, (this) boundary-stele out of gratitude because 4.ʾĪlmuquh [had pro]tected the person of his servant 5.n and his children and his cattle during the expedition 6.which he undertook. And may ʾĪlmuqu[h] continue to 7.[..] his servant Salmān and his 8.[..] and his cattle under all 9.[..]. By ʿAthtar and by ʾ
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.Salmān [bin … …] 2.Dhū-Saḥar has dedicated to ʾĪlmuquh, Lor[d] 3.[of ʾA]wwām, (this) boundary-stele out of gratitude because 4.ʾĪlmuquh [had pro]tected the person of his servant [Salmā-] 5.n and his children and his cattle during the expedition 6.which he undertook. And may ʾĪlmuqu[h] continue to [pro-] 7.tect his servant Salmān and his chi[ld-] 8.ren and his cattle under all [circum-] 9.stances. By ʿAthtar and by ʾĪ[lmuquh].

Text preserved in this squeeze:
Salmān
Dhū-Saḥar has dedicated to ʾĪlmuquh,
of ʾAwwām, this boundary-stele out of gratitude because
ʾĪlmuquh had protected the person of his servant
n and his children and his cattle during the expedition
which he undertook. And may ʾĪlmuquh continue to
.. his servant Salmān and his
.. and his cattle under all
... By ʿAthtar and by ʾ
Restored full text of the inscription:
Salmān bin … …
Dhū-Saḥar has dedicated to ʾĪlmuquh, Lord
of ʾAwwām, this boundary-stele out of gratitude because
ʾĪlmuquh had protected the person of his servant Salmā-
n and his children and his cattle during the expedition
which he undertook. And may ʾĪlmuquh continue to pro-
tect his servant Salmān and his child-
ren and his cattle under all circum-
stances. By ʿAthtar and by ʾĪlmuquh.
